response.original_title: Whina: Te Whaea o te Motu (Mother of the Nation)
response.overview: The autobiography of Maori land activist Dame Whina Cooper filmed two years before she died. Born in an earth-floor whare she became a teacher, gum digger, rugby coach, midwife, a tribal leader, president of Maori Women's Welfare League and controversial leader of the Maori Land March. Who organized her first public protest at the age of 18.
response.title: Whina: Te Whaea o te Motu (Mother of the Nation)
